history.content:
First, I think you should talk to the Financial Aid Office because they are more qualified to answer this type of question. Make sure you talk to them before taking any actions based on my (and anyone else's) answers.

Second, you should talk to the instructor of the course to talk about possible ways to prevent failing.

My personal opinion: Nothing will happen to your financial aid unless you have merit-based aid (like scholarships) that stipulate a certain GPA or passing classes. I doubt this will affect your aid for next year unless your GPA significantly changed (and even then I think it would only affect merit-based aid). Falling below the 13 unit requirement isn't a concern because you are still enrolled in the class, whether you pass or not.

First, I think you should talk to the Financial Aid Office because they are more qualified to answer this type of question. Make sure you talk to them before taking any actions based on my (and anyone else's) answers.

Second, you should talk to the instructor of the course to talk about possible ways to prevent failing.

My personal opinion: Nothing will happen to your financial aid unless you have merit-based aid (like scholarships) that stipulate a certain GPA or passing classes. I doubt this will affect your aid for next year unless your GPA significantly changed (and even then I think it would only affect merit-based aid).

I am a third year L&S CS student taking a 4 unit P/NP breadth requirement. I am likely going to fail the course and I am currently taking 16 units total this semester, the rest of which I intend to to pass. If I fail this class will it bring me under the per semester unit requirement and cause me to lose financial aid? I am in good academic standing otherwise. 

Thanks!
history.subject: Might fail a 4 unit P/NP course
